title: Mixed Gunshots
description: 330 high quality realistic gunshots for handgun, assault rifle, machinegun, shotgun, heavy artillery, silenced weapon, etc.
longDescription:
TRAILER


One of the differences between indie games and AAA games is the sound and especially the gun sounds and this is because, as a sound engineer, it is much harder to achieve a great sound for the gunshots than for anything else. The problem with the gunshots is that if you simply record them, the gunshots will not sound amazing, it doesn't matter how good or expensive are the microphones you are using to record the sounds. First of all, you will need at least 3 or 4 microphones but some engineers are using up to 10 microphones to record a single gunshot from different perspectives. All those perspectives have to be mixed together, digitally processed (equalized, filtered, mastered) and after hours of work per sound, you will get the satisfying punchy and powerful sound you expect.


This UE5 pack contains 330 high quality sounds carefully designed to take your game to the next level. There are 66 different guns and each gun comes with 5 different sounds. All those different sounds per weapon, together with a random playing system and a sound concurrency setup, gives the player a feeling of authenticity and realism (because every time the player fires, there is a different combination of sounds being played). The pack comes with a basic automatic fire system and because of the ingenious combination between random sounds and sound concurrency setup, you will not need any loops to achieve realistic automatic fire for all guns.


I tried o offer as much variety as possible, so there are gunshots with long tail, specific to exterior and there are also gunshots with small tail specific to closed spaces. From this point of view, the sound effects can be very useful for open world games but also for games where actions takes place indoor.


Are you tired of gunshots that sound like toys? If this is the case, this pack is exactly what you need...

technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  High quality and realistic sounds
  •  No need for loop sounds (a combination of sound concurrency setup, random single shots and automatic fire system make automatic fire realistic so there is no need of using audio loops)
  •  Professionally mixed and mastered

Number of Audio Waves: 330

Number of Audio Cues: 66

Sample rate / bit rate: 44,100 Hz

Do Sound FX loop: No

Supported Development Platforms:

Windows: Yes

Mac: Yes

Documentation: All you need to know in order to test the sound effects is written inside the Demo Level:

  1. Press Left Mouse Button to fire the current gunshot sound effect
  2. Use the keys "1" or "2" to change the current gunshot
  3. Hold Left Mouse Button for automatic fire

Important/Additional Notes: For those who want to change the fire rate of the weapons, in the First Person Character Blueprint there is a variable called: Firerate, which now has a value of 0.08. Increase or decrease that number to get different fire rates. This pack contains only gunshot sound effects (no reloading, cocking, etc. )


If you like this pack, feel free to write a review and rate it. This will keep me motivated to create better and better assets. Thank you!
